intro: Archibaccharis standleyi var. aequivenia, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
